units.title: Versene pre‑treatment for hPSC dissociation
units.text: Aspirate the culture medium and wash the cells with 1 ml of room temperature PBS. After aspirating the PBS, add 500 µl of pre‑warmed Versene solution (or room temperature 0.5 mM EDTA) and incubate at 37 °C in an incubator for 5–6 min.
units.rationale: Pre‑treats cells to loosen adhesion before enzymatic dissociation.

units.title: AccuMAX enzymatic dissociation of hPSCs
units.text: Aspirate 1 ml of PBS and add 0.5 ml of Accumax solution (pre‑warmed to 37 °C) and put the plate in a 37 °C incubator for 12–18 min. Every 3–4 min, take the plate out of the incubator and tap gently to facilitate hPSC dissociation.
units.rationale: Enzymatically separates hPSCs into single cells for downstream steps.

units.title: Neutralization of AccuMAX digestion
units.text: After Accumax dissociation, add 0.5 ml of 10% (vol/vol) FBS medium to neutralize the digestion reaction. Now, the total volume of cell solution is ~1 ml.
units.rationale: Stops enzymatic activity and protects cells after dissociation.

units.title: Seeding hPSCs for iNPC differentiation
units.text: Seed 40,000 hPSCs in one Matrigel‑coated well of a 12‑well plate with 1 ml of mTeSR Plus medium supplemented with 10 µM Y27632.
units.rationale: Provides a defined cell density and survival support for differentiation.

units.title: Initiation of Phase I differentiation
units.text: Day 0. Before initiating the differentiation, first aspirate the culture medium and wash with 1 ml of PBS, before adding 1 ml of the phase I medium (Table 6).
units.rationale: Starts the first stage of hPSC‑to‑iNPC differentiation with fresh medium.

units.title: Transition to Phase II medium (Day 4)
units.text: On day 4, aspirate the phase I medium and add 1.2 ml of phase II medium (Table 6).
units.rationale: Advances cells to posterior intermediate mesoderm stage.

units.title: Transition to Phase III medium (Day 7)
units.text: On day 7, aspirate the phase II medium and add 1.2 ml of phase III medium (Table 6).

units.title: iNPC aggregation in low‑attachment plates
units.text: Seed ~25,000–30,000 iNPCs into one well of a 96‑well U‑bottom low‑attachment plate in 100 µl of hNPSR‑v2 medium and then centrifuge the plate at 300g for 5 min.
units.rationale: Forms uniform iNPC aggregates for subsequent organoid culture.

units.title: Transfer of iNPC aggregates to Transwell for air‑liquid interface
units.text: The iNPC aggregates are transferred to the membrane of a Transwell for air–liquid interface culture. First, in a six‑well Transwell plate, add 1 ml of phase I medium (Table 7) to the bottom chamber of each well.
units.rationale: Sets up the air‑liquid interface that promotes nephron organoid development.

units.title: Phase I to Phase II medium change in Transwell culture
units.text: Place the Transwell plate in the incubator for 1 h. After 1 h, remove the phase I medium and directly add 1 ml of phase II medium (Table 7) into the bottom chamber of the Transwell plate.
units.rationale: Switches signaling environment to support further nephron maturation.
